title: عَدَا وَخَلَا وَحَاشَا
titleEn: Exception with Ada, Khala, and Hasha
description: Learn about the exception particles عَدَا، خَلَا، حَاشَا which can function as verbs or prepositions, plus ليس and لا يكون in exception.

notes.title: Introduction to عَدَا، خَلَا، حَاشَا
content: In addition to the primary exception particle إِلَّا, Arabic has three words that can express exception: عَدَا (except), خَلَا (except), and حَاشَا (far be it / except). What makes these unique is that they can function as either verbs or prepositions.

When treated as verbs, the word after them is مَنْصُوب (accusative) as a مَفْعُول بِهِ. When treated as prepositions, the word after them is مَجْرُور (genitive). Both analyses are grammatically correct.
keyPoints: Can be verbs (فعل) or prepositions (حرف جر)
As verb: word after is منصوب (مفعول به)
As preposition: word after is مجرور

examples.english: The people came except Zayd (both cases acceptable)
They attended except Muhammad
I love fruits except apples
The students passed except one student

notes.title: عَدَا، خَلَا، حَاشَا as Verbs
content: When عَدَا، خَلَا، حَاشَا are analyzed as verbs, they are جَامِدَة (frozen/uninflected verbs) - they don't conjugate for different subjects or tenses. The subject is implied (هُوَ or هُمْ referring to 'someone/they').
As verbs, they take a مَفْعُول بِهِ (direct object) which is the thing excepted. This object is in the مَنْصُوب (accusative) case.
keyPoints: Takes مفعول به in منصوب case

examples.english: The people came, [someone] excepted Zayd (زَيْدًا = مفعول به منصوب)
I read the books except one book (كِتَابًا = مفعول به)
I respect everyone except the liar (الْكَاذِبَ = مفعول به)
The students passed except one (وَاحِدًا = مفعول به منصوب)

notes.title: عَدَا، خَلَا، حَاشَا as Prepositions
content: When عَدَا، خَلَا، حَاشَا are analyzed as prepositions (حُرُوفُ جَرٍّ), the word after them takes the genitive case (مَجْرُور). This is the simpler analysis and is common in classical usage.
The prepositional analysis is particularly common for حَاشَا, which many grammarians consider primarily a preposition.
keyPoints: حَاشَا often analyzed as preposition only

examples.english: The people came except Zayd (زَيْدٍ = اسم مجرور)
I love food except fish (السَّمَكِ = مجرور)
Far be it from Allah (اللهِ = مجرور)
They attended except my brother (أَخِي = مجرور)

notes.title: مَا عَدَا and مَا خَلَا
content: When مَا المصدرية (the masdar-forming ما) precedes عَدَا or خَلَا, they MUST be analyzed as verbs. In this case, the word after is obligatorily مَنْصُوب (accusative).
The مَا makes the entire phrase into a مصدر مؤول (interpreted infinitive), giving the meaning 'excepting X' or 'the excepting of X'. This is the only case where the verb analysis is required.

examples.english: The people came excepting Zayd (only نَصْب possible)
I read the books excepting one (واحِدًا = مفعول به)
They passed excepting one student
I love them all excepting the liar

notes.title: لَيْسَ and لَا يَكُونُ in Exception
content: The verbs لَيْسَ (is not) and لَا يَكُونُ (will not be) can also be used for exception. In this usage, the excepted noun is the خَبَر of لَيْسَ/لَا يَكُونُ and takes the مَنْصُوب (accusative) case.
This construction is less common than عَدَا/خَلَا/حَاشَا but appears in classical texts. The meaning is 'the people came, not being Zayd' or 'except it is not Zayd'.
keyPoints: Less common than other exception words

examples.english: The people came, not Zayd (زَيْدًا = خبر ليس)
They attended except Khalid
I love fruits, not apples
The students passed except one

notes.title: Comparison of Exception Methods
content: Arabic has multiple ways to express exception. إِلَّا is the most common and versatile. عَدَا، خَلَا، حَاشَا offer flexibility (verb or preposition). مَا عَدَا/مَا خَلَا require accusative. لَيْسَ/لَا يَكُونُ are less common alternatives.
The choice between methods often depends on stylistic preference, meter in poetry, or specific grammatical contexts. All convey the same basic meaning of exception.

examples.english: They came except Zayd (with إِلَّا)
They came except Zayd (جَرّ or نَصْب)
They came excepting Zayd (نَصْب only)
They came, not Zayd

exercises.prompt: عَدَا وَخَلَا وَحَاشَا يُمْكِنُ أَنْ تَكُونَ أَفْعَالًا أَوْ حُرُوفَ _____
exercises.promptEn: عَدَا، خَلَا، and حَاشَا can be verbs or _____ particles

exercises.prompt: إِذَا كَانَتْ عَدَا فِعْلًا، فَالاِسْمُ بَعْدَهَا _____ لِأَنَّهُ مَفْعُولٌ بِهِ
exercises.promptEn: If عَدَا is a verb, the noun after it is _____ because it's a direct object

exercises.prompt: إِذَا سَبَقَتْ مَا الْمَصْدَرِيَّةُ عَدَا أَوْ خَلَا، فَيَجِبُ أَنْ يَكُونَ الاِسْمُ بَعْدَهُمَا _____
exercises.promptEn: If مَا المصدرية precedes عَدَا or خَلَا, the noun after them MUST be _____

exercises.prompt: جَاءَ الْقَوْمُ لَيْسَ زَيْدًا - زَيْدًا هُنَا خَبَرُ _____ مَنْصُوبٌ
exercises.promptEn: The people came except Zayd - زَيْدًا here is the predicate of _____ in accusative

exercises.prompt: حَاشَا اللهِ - كَلِمَةُ اللهِ مَجْرُورَةٌ لِأَنَّ حَاشَا هُنَا حَرْفُ _____
exercises.promptEn: Far be it from Allah - اللهِ is genitive because حَاشَا here is a _____ particle

exercises.prompt: عَدَا وَخَلَا وَحَاشَا كَأَفْعَالٍ هِيَ أَفْعَالٌ _____ لَا تَتَصَرَّفُ
exercises.promptEn: عَدَا، خَلَا، and حَاشَا as verbs are _____ verbs that don't conjugate

exercises.answer: Except / other than (exception particle or verb)
Except / other than (exception particle or verb)

exercises.prompt: A frozen verb that doesn't conjugate for different subjects
The مَا that forms a مصدر مؤول (interpreted infinitive)
